intro: Pecteilis longicorniculata, commonly known as the longhorned pecteilis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with finely divided blades and produces small, white to yellowish flowers clustered in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
